Package org.zone.commands.system

Interface ArgumentCommand

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractCreateZoneStartCommand, EditBoundsStartCommand, LeaveZoneCommand, ZoneCreateChunkStartCommand, ZoneCreateChunkSubStartCommand, ZoneCreateEndCommand, ZoneCreateStartCommand, ZoneCreateSubStartCommand, ZoneFlagBlockBreakSetEnabledCommand, ZoneFlagBlockBreakSetGroupCommand, ZoneFlagBlockBreakViewCommand, ZoneFlagBlockPlaceSetEnabledCommand, ZoneFlagBlockPlaceSetGroupCommand, ZoneFlagBlockPlaceViewCommand, ZoneFlagDamageAttackSetEnabledCommand, ZoneFlagDamageAttackSetGroupCommand, ZoneFlagEntrySetEnabledCommand, ZoneFlagGreetingsRemoveCommand, ZoneFlagGreetingsSetMessageCommand, ZoneFlagGreetingsViewCommand, ZoneFlagInteractDoorEnabledCommand, ZoneFlagInteractDoorGroupCommand, ZoneFlagInteractDoorViewCommand, ZoneFlagInteractItemframesEnableDisableCommand, ZoneFlagInteractItemframesGroupCommand, ZoneFlagInteractItemframesViewCommand, ZoneFlagLeavingRemoveCommand, ZoneFlagLeavingSetMessageCommand, ZoneFlagLeavingViewCommand, ZoneFlagMemberGroupAddCommand, ZoneFlagMemberGroupViewCommand, ZoneFlagPlayerFallDamageEnableDisable, ZoneFlagViewBalanceCommand, ZoneInfoBoundsShowCommand, ZoneInfoCommand, ZonePluginInfoCommand
public interface ArgumentCommand
An argument command is a command that uses CommandArgument as its arguments.

  • Method Details

    • getArguments

      @NotNull @NotNull List<CommandArgument<?>> getArguments()
      Gets the arguments of the command. This should be a list of arguments that do not change
      Returns:
      A list of command arguments

    • getDescription

      @NotNull @NotNull net.kyori.adventure.text.Component getDescription()
      Gets a description of the command, designing to inform the user on what the command does.
      Returns:
      A string of the description

    • getPermissionNode

      @NotNull @NotNull Optional<String> getPermissionNode()
      Gets the permission node of the command that is required to run the command. If a permission is not required then this should return Optional.empty()

      When checking to see if this command has permission you should use hasPermission(CommandCause)

      Returns:
      The permission to the command

    • run

      @NotNull @NotNull org.spongepowered.api.command.CommandResult run​(@NotNull @NotNull CommandContext commandContext, @NotNull @NotNull String... args)
      Runs the command
      Parameters:
      commandContext - The command context for this command
      args - The arguments for the command
      Returns:
      if the command should show the usage (false to show)

    • hasPermission

      default boolean hasPermission​(@NotNull @NotNull org.spongepowered.api.command.CommandCause source)
      If the command source has permission to run this command
      Parameters:
      source - The command source to compare
      Returns:
      If the source has permission to run the command
